roleset.name: get

roles.note: see the 4th, 5th and 8th examples to see why arg4 was apparently added, and to see when to use it.

example.name: basic
example.text: Edison customers have received electric service since April 1985.

example.name: as exchange
example.text: Stockholders will receive one Cray Computer share for every two Cray Research shares they own in a distribution.
example.arg: for every two Cray Research shares they own

example.name: with giver
example.text: Anyone can receive more than $10k in cash from a client in one or more related transactions.
example.arg: in one or more related transactions

example.name: ex 4: where arg4 is necessary
example.text: The company hadn't yet received any documents from OSHA regarding the penalty or fine.
example.note: Arg4 was created for instances like this where there is no ICH link linking "any documents" and "regarding the penalty or fine".

example.name: ex 5: another attribute
example.text: Georgia Gulf received a new takeover bid from investor Harold Simmons of $50 million a share.
example.note: Another example with no ICH link

example.name: Medical: Arg1 as medication
example.text: Should a patient with diverticulitis and previous radiation of adrenal glands receive steroids?
example.arg: a patient with diverticulitis and previous radiation of adrenal glands

example.name: Medical: Arg1 as treatment
example.text: Patients who-1 *T*-1 receive chemotherapy frequently develop anemia.

roleset.note: Based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with get and gain. Member of Vncls obtain-13.5.2. Checked by Julia, 10/2010.

example.name: with attribute as part of arg1, as it should be
example.text: Clinton Gas Systems Inc. said it received a contract *ICH*-1 from Timken Co. , Canton , Ohio , [to manage the natural gas purchasing , scheduling and transportation activities for Timken 's seven Ohio and two Pennsylvania plants]-1 .
example.note: This example properly has the ICH link, and therefore arg4 is unnecessary.
